Hey!  I've been a Trasnformers fan since the mid-eighties, but was m=
ostly of the toys as a kid.  I remember my favorite toy was the old brick P=
owermaster Prime and Predaking.  I was more of a cartoon fan and random iss=
ues of the comics, which I barely knew existed.

I remembered in the mid ni=
neties catching a random episode of Beast Wars on television (I think Call =
of the Fuzors), and hadn't even realized Transformers was still around.

I =
began to peter into the fandom once I Found things like ATT (Alt-Toys-Trans=
formers).  I watched most of Beast Machines, but only caught Beast Wars aft=
er the fact.  I guess what really made me full blown 'into it' again was Ro=
bots in Disguise, which is still one of my favorite series.  

Mostly into =
the Marvel comics (primarily the Marvel UK ones), and I love Simon Furman's=
 work, and Budianski is awesome.  Not hugely into the Dreawmwave ones, and =
the IDW are hit and miss.  I rather like a lot of the Collector's Club thin=
gs.

I missed most of the Unicron Trilogy, have seen -all- of Animated, and=
 LOVE the ALlspark Almanacs.  I've always been more into the fiction than t=
he toys, for whatever reason - probably it's easier to afford cartoon DVD's=
 than toys.  Love the live action movies as well.

Favorite series is Trans=
formers ANimated by far - love the toys, they have so much pesronality.

Uh=
m, getting into RP'ing..  My first Trasfnromers club I joined ~ 1999 or so,=
 got into a steady one around 2001 for those of you who know me in it (Tran=
sformers the Fall of Night) and have been kicking around there since.  Spor=
adically do Tabletop sessions and the occasional MUD, but that's about it a=
s far as things go.

Anyways, nice to meet you all here!  And you can tell =
me when to start posting for 'In the Jungle' again whenever the thread pick=
s up, and will be on Wheelie as needed.
